## Title

**World Development Indicators (2022)**  
A concise walk‑through of results from the report.

---

## Data & Setup

- Source: World Bank WDI [@worldbank_wdi]
- Unit of analysis: Countries, year 2022
- Indicators used: GDP per capita, life expectancy, inflation, unemployment, exports share, primary school enrolment

```{python}
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")
df.columns = [c.strip().lower().replace(" ", "_") for c in df.columns]
```

---

## Summary snapshot

```{python}
summary = df[["gdp_per_capita","life_expectancy","inflation_rate","unemployment_rate"]].describe().T
summary
```

---

## Income & Health

```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(7,5))
ax.scatter(df["gdp_per_capita"], df["life_expectancy"], alpha=0.7)
ax.set_xlabel("GDP per capita (US$)")
ax.set_ylabel("Life expectancy (years)")
ax.set_title("Income vs. Health (2022)")
plt.tight_layout()
```

**Reading:** Positive association; outliers exist.

---

## Top 10 GDP per capita

```{python}
top = df.dropna(subset=["gdp_per_capita"]).nlargest(10, "gdp_per_capita")
top[["country","gdp_per_capita"]]
```

```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8,5))
ax.barh(top["country"], top["gdp_per_capita"])
ax.invert_yaxis()
ax.set_xlabel("GDP per capita (US$)")
ax.set_title("Top 10 countries, 2022")
plt.tight_layout()
```

---

## Takeaways

- Higher income aligns with longer life expectancy.  
- Macro conditions vary widely across countries.  
- Results are reproducible with Quarto [@quarto_doc].
